page.title: 16"The Yealmpton Press"
page.content: When the Church Magazine first began losing money, the Parochial Church Council decided to set up an independent all-embracing village magazine. Incorporating the former Church News, it's aim was to provide a service to the village with a monthly diary of events, news of the village clubs and groups and articles of general interest. With financial backing from the P.C.C., the Parish Council and advertising revenue from local businesses (1 page cost Â£60 p.a.), the 38 page{"Yealmpton Press" } was launched on November 1st. 1984 at a price of 15p per copy. The 5-member editorial panel, headed by Mrs Sue Arnold and including the Parish Priest-in-charge, are supported by a committee co-ordinating the Monthly magazine distribution, it's printing, advertising and Village Diary.
